byline.contributor: Employees of The New York Times contributed reporting from Anbar and Salahuddin Provinces.

abstract: Iraqi military leaders, bolstered by retaking city of Tikrit from Islamic State militants, say they plan to enter Sunni territory of Anbar Province in country's west to rout militant strongholds there; some question wisdom of using Shiite forces to retake Sunni territory, raising concerns over how to accomplish task.
lead_paragraph: Sunni leaders balk at the idea of Shiite militias, which were vital in Tikrit, being a substantial force in an offensive in Anbar Province.

headline.main: After Victory Over ISIS in Tikrit, Next Battle Requires a New Template
headline.print_headline: After Victory Over ISIS in Tikrit, Next Battle Requires a New Template

snippet: Sunni leaders balk at the idea of Shiite militias, which were vital in Tikrit, being a substantial force in an offensive in Anbar Province.
